CHAWLA, Plaintiff-Appellant,v.Charles McCAUSLAND, Lt. Gen., Director, Defense LogisticsAgency, Defendant-Appellee.
    No. 90-3680.
    United States Court of Appeals, Sixth Circuit.
    Jan. 30, 1991.
    
      S.D. Ohio, No. 90-0094;  George C. Smith, J.
      S.D. Ohio
      AFFIRMED.
      Before RALPH B. GUY, Jr. and BOGGS, Circuit Judges, and LIVELY, Senior Circuit Judge.
    
    ORDER
    
      1
      This pro se plaintiff appeals the district court's order dismissing his employment discrimination action as untimely.  The appeal has been referred to a panel of the court pursuant to Rule 9(a), Rules of the Sixth Circuit.  The panel unanimously agrees that oral argument is not necessary.  Fed.R.App.P. 34(a).
    
    
      2
      Akhlaq Chawla sought reinstatement, back pay, monetary damages and other relief in this employment discrimination suit filed under Title VII, 42 U.S.C. Sec. 2000e-16(c).  He alleged that defendant employer discriminated against him on the basis of religion and national origin.  Chawla first pursued administrative remedies.  He received a "Notice of Final Agency Decision" on January 17, 1989, advising him of his right to file a civil action "...
